main_definition: A lightbox is a device used to illuminate objects, often in photography or art display settings.

meanings_and_examples.example: The photographer set up the lightbox to evenly illuminate his subject for portrait photography.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A container with a transparent front
meanings_and_examples.example: She placed her artwork in the clear plastic lightbox so that it could be displayed and viewed from all angles.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A software or web application feature
meanings_and_examples.example: The online course platform provides interactive lessons using a built-in lightbox to highlight text, images, or videos for better viewing.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An alternative name for an illuminated document holder
meanings_and_examples.example: He used the lightbox as an overhead projector to display his presentation slides on a screen.
